text: The men's 400 metres hurdles event was part of the track and field athletics programme at the 1920 Summer Olympics. The competition was held on Sunday, August 15, 1920, and on Monday, August 16, 1920. 19 runners from 9 nations competed. ==Records== These were the standing world and Olympic records (in seconds) prior to the 1920 Summer Olympics. {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:95%;" |- ! World Record | 54.2 | John Norton | Pasadena (USA) | June 26, 1920 |- ! Olympic Record | 55.0 | Charles Bacon | London (GBR) | July 22, 1908 |} Frank Loomis set a new world record with 54.0 seconds in the final. ==Results== ===Quarterfinals=== Quarterfinal 1 {| class=wikitable style="text- align:center" !
